attributes.action: Mandatory motorway driving tuition for all learners.
attributes.background:
Driving tuition is currently only carried out in towns and cities, reverse parking and 3 point turns are all well and good but it is time all learners were instructed to drive safely on motorways.
Motorway driving is completely different to urban and city driving, lets all make them a safer place.

attributes.action: Keep May 4th 2020 as a bank holiday
attributes.background: Ministers are poised to move the May Day bank holiday next year so that it falls on Friday, May 8 — the 75th anniversary of Germany’s unconditional surrender in Europe.Greg Clark, the business secretary, is reported to have asked the chancellor for permission to move the date from Monday, May 4th.
attributes.additional_details: VE Day marked the formal acceptance by the Allies of Nazi Germany’s unconditional surrender in the Second World War. The Trades Union Congress  called for the 75th anniversary to be given a separate bank holiday. Although the origins of the May Day holiday are thought to lie in a Roman festival to mark the start of summer, in modern times the bank holiday has celebrated the struggle for workers’ rights.

attributes.action: GCSEs to be replaced by a mix of academic and vocational subjects at A-levels.
attributes.background: I have been a secondary teacher for many years and I think the current GCSEs belong to an era when young people left education at 16. Let's have a baccalaureate system to replace A-levels, with a mix of arts, sciences and vocational subjects and exams at the age of 18.

attributes.action: Require coffee shops to charge more for disposables
attributes.background:
In a time where climate change and pollution are major issues we face, we still throw away 7 million coffee cups per day.

A change in the law should be made to make coffee shops be required to charge the same price, or greater prices, than eating or drinking in, for disposable cups and wrappers.
attributes.additional_details:
A petition like this could encourage people to buy food or drinks in reusable containers, rather than take the cheaper option of buying a throwaway cup.

https://www.independent.co.uk/environment/disposable-coffee-cups-how-big-problem-environment-landfill-recycling-incinerate-export-rubbish-a8142381.html

attributes.action: Allow students to have open book exams and supported with equations and formulae
attributes.background: more and more students are increasingly struggling to get a grip on the new GCSE format students are being made to memorise hundreds of different quotes from multiple books and poems
attributes.additional_details:
whilst also remembering key dates and theories in other subjects this is extremely challenging as it is becoming more about the memory skill rather than knowledge . furthermore a students are required to remember several different equations for subjects like maths and science this is beyond a students capacity and is overwhelming to the students health and well being . Anxiety and depression is most common amongst young people due to exam stress and revision . 
There needs to be a drastic change

attributes.action: Eliminate the effects of the use of single-use plastic in takeaway restaurants.
attributes.background: We are a group of sixth form students who are highly concerned with the use of single-use plastics. This is because it uses fossil fuels, is non- biodegradable and pollutes our oceans resulting in the killing of animals and disruption of food chains.
attributes.additional_details: We are increasingly worried about the future of our planet, with plastic contributing to a huge carbon footprint. We want to eliminate the use of unnecessary plastic in takeaways nationally.

attributes.action: Increase donations to food banks by forcing schools to give away uneaten food
attributes.background: In the UK, £13,000,000 of food is thrown away daily. This is unnecessary and wasteful. There are many people who are in great need of substantial meals and schools in particular could easily reduce their environmental impact and help those in need by donating to food banks at the end of each day.

attributes.action: Winter Tyres should be compulsory from October - April,
attributes.background: It's that time of year when temperatures start to plunge and drivers should be switching to winter tyres to avoid being caught out by snow and ice on the roads. Winter tyres can cut accidents and give you much better grip on the road even in wet condition
attributes.additional_details: There is a difference between summer and winter tyres. Winter tyres are made of a different rubber compound with a high silica content which makes them softer and tread pattern has small slits in the tread blocks so they grip the road better, and allow you to safely brake on snow and ice. Drivers are better off with winter tyres whenever the temperature dips below 7C. Cars with winter tyres have significantly shorter braking distances about 20 percent on wet surfaces a little longer on snow/ice

attributes.action: Introcude machines in the supermarkets to recycle pet bottles, cans and get paid
attributes.background: Encourage the government to install recyclable machines in the supermarkets to recycle pet bottles, cans and get paid in vouchers, this would encourage customers to recycle and get paid for that’s, that’s a win for win.
attributes.additional_details: In my recent trip to Germany I went to a supermarket and realised that they have machines installed across every single supermarket that’s encourages customers to recycle pet bottles and cans, furthermore they get vouchers from the supermarket that reduces their daily shopping costs by just recycling their cans and bottles. living in the uk, this is a must it’s win-win for both sides, customers bring the materials and get paid, the government reduced the plastic cost and reuses the old plastic.

attributes.action: Provide funding for school children to access leisure centres or gyms
attributes.background: Leisure centre memberships are expensive and many families cannot afford them. This is why I think pupils from primary to end of secondary schools should be provided with them. First to motivate more children to get into sports and to get fitter and to resolve Britain’s immense problem with obesity.
attributes.additional_details:
Did you know that in England the prevalence of overweight and obesity is above 70% among all age groups from 45 upwards.
 
For more information go visit https://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN03336/SN03336.pdf

attributes.action: Increase the Minimum wage for Under 18's, because it is too low to cover costs
attributes.background: The current UK minimum wage is £4.20. It violates rights for under 18's. And its harder for young adults to be able to save and invest. It creates boundaries. There are many costs which they cannot cover. Prices for food, drinks and clothes have gone up. So why cant the price of hourly wage go up.
attributes.additional_details: Currently most UK teenagers are being forced to work for £4.20 an hour. Some of those cannot provide enough to support their families. The cost for living has gone up. Its more expensive to live in this day and era. The price of a cup of coffee is £3.50. The price of daily necessities has increased rapidly. More and more families are becoming vulnerable, and parents of those young workers may not be able to provide for them. So they get a job. But £4.20 an hour is the price of peanuts.

attributes.action: Get crustaceans included under the Animal Welfare Act 2006.
attributes.background: Help us make the selling and cooking of live crustaceans (lobsters, crabs etc) illegal and get them included under the Animal Welfare Act 2006.
attributes.additional_details:
Our aim is to insure anyone farming, storing or slaughtering them must abide by animal welfare rules. Therefore, providing good water quality, enough food, humane slaughter and protection from pain.

There’s scientific evidence suggesting that crabs, lobsters, prawns and crayfish experience pain and emotion. Yet they are still sold, torn apart and boiled alive. Authorities were powerless to prosecute because these animals aren’t currently covered under animal welfare legislation.

attributes.action: Make law for dogs to be insured for damage injury to humans and other species
attributes.background: In order to make people more responsible for dog ownership make it law for all dogs to be covered  against injury death damage to humans to other species and property

attributes.action: Stop NI contributions affected by the 1995 and 2011 Pension Acts
attributes.background: 1995 and 2011 Pension Acts means thousands will have worked for over 50 years by the time they reach SPa. This petition ensures some financial compensation for this group of women by ceasing NI contribution for those women who would have made sufficient contribution before they reach SPa.
attributes.additional_details: I cannot provide accurate evidence of the number of women affected by this proposal. However, in my own situation and hearsay evidence from women in my age group this change would mean that the last year or few years before reaching SPa, some women would benefit financially albeit they may pay additional tax on the additional money not deducted by  NI contributions.

attributes.action: Recognise National Assembly leader Juan Guaidó as acting president of Venezuela.
attributes.background: In May 2018, Venezuela held presidential elections that were condemned as "neither free nor fair" by the UK. In 2019 Nicolás Maduro was sworn-in as President. But the Venezuelan Constitution states that the president of the National Assembly must take office temporarily until new elections are held.
attributes.additional_details: Venezuela, a country that was once a stable democracy and a strong economy, is now plagued by a dictatorial regime that is starving its citizens, stands accused by the UN Human Rights Commissioner of systematically murdering and torturing protesters, and has triggered the biggest refugee crisis in the history of the Americas.

attributes.action: Lower the age of being able to change your name by deed poll to 13
attributes.background: A teenager should be able to change their name if they want to and not have to wait until they are 16.
attributes.additional_details:
I know a lot of teens that wanted to change their names before they hit 13 but they couldn't because they don't always have permission off both parents even if one parent has been absent for most of their lives or has caused destruction in their lives.
They should have the right to decide.

attributes.action: Funded places in nurseries for children with disabled parents!
attributes.background: For 10 months I have been trying to find affordable childcare for my daughter. I have Cystic Fibrosis and spend long periods in hospital. People cannot keep taking time off to look after her and I simply cannot afford that amount of money. There needs to be an option for disabled parents!!
attributes.additional_details: Sometimes parents with disabilities/invisible illnesses need time on hospital and for people like me with little family it can be hard to find affordable childcare. I myself cannot work, therefore have limited funds. I think there should be an option for some free hours/place at nurseries from birth instead of just the 2 year funding, my disability effects my daughter from birth. What Should I do if no one can have her? I need an option to fall back on and no other services can help me!

attributes.action: Allow Polish people freedom of movement after the Brexit.
attributes.background: We owe the Polish for fighting the Germans in WW2 in the air and on the ground. This is fact.
attributes.additional_details: The Polish are very patriotic people and should be allowed with open arms into the UK.

attributes.action: Urge Bank of England to remove tallow (cow flesh) from new £20 and £50 notes
attributes.background: The new, polymer £20 and £50 note denominations are set to continue using tallow (cow flesh) as a component. This is UNACCEPTABLE to the current 3.5 million vegans, 7 million vegetarians, 817,000 Hindus and many others in the UK who all oppose the slaughter of cows.
attributes.additional_details:
This is over 17% of the UK population!

NUMBER OF VEGANS AND VEGETARIANS IN THE UK:
 
https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/food-and-drink/vegans-uk-rise-popularity-plant-based-diets-veganism-figures-survey-compare-the-market-a8286471.html
 
(https://www.comparethemarket.com/car-insurance/content/cars-against-humanity/)
 
NUMBER OF HINDUS IN THE UK:
 
https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/culturalidentity/religion/articles/religioninenglandandwales2011/2012-12-11

attributes.action: Reduce the number of days in a year a workers union can strike to 12 days a year
attributes.background: Over the last 12 months union strikes have disrupted public transport. At the moment operators like Northern have been striking every Saturday since October 2018. I would like to  introduce a cap of 12 days a year for unions to use for there strike days.

attributes.action: Increase the maximum jail term for flying a drone over a UK airport to 10 years.
attributes.background:
The signatories to this petition want to see the maximum sentence for flying an unmanned drone over a UK airport increased from 5 to 10 years.

We also want clear direction given to the courts that severe sentences - close to or at the maximum - should be handed down for such reckless behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
We have recently seen (December 2018) the scant disregard for the safety of aircraft, passengers and staff by those intentionally flying an unmanned drone over protected airspace at London Gatwick Airport.

Given the risk to human life from such reckless actions, and the significant cost and disruption, signatories to this period want to see the minimum sentence raised to ten years and used for mindless idiots endangering life.

attributes.action: Ban Drones
attributes.background: Drones are not safe for private citizens to handle. Drones are a government device and should not be in the use of civilian and private hands. This is similar to the issue of guns and semi-automatic weapons; they just don't belong in the hands of private citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Drones are like small airplanes that are not manned. Why would anyone without a pilot's license even be allowed to have one? I believe these planes in the wrong hands could do a lot of damage. They have the potential for so much harm when used for the wrong reasons. They infringe on peoples privacy, not to mention the danger of accidents involving drones.

attributes.action: Allow more funding for Ex-Military and Ex-Service personnel suffering with PTSD.
attributes.background: It is far too common for our Ex- Service and Ex-Military personnel to be suffering with PTSD. People who suffer from PTSD often suffer from nightmares, flashbacks, difficulty sleeping, and feeling emotionally numb. These symptoms can significantly impair a person's daily life.
attributes.additional_details:
Why should the people who fought so hard for our lives be the ones left to suffer?

PTSD is marked by clear physical and psychological symptoms. It often has symptoms like depression, substance abuse, problems of memory and cognition, and other physical and mental health problems. The disorder is also associated with difficulties in social or family life, including occupational instability, marital problems, family discord, and difficulties in parenting.

REF- https://www.military.com/benefits/veterans-health-care/posttraumatic-stress-disorder-overview.html

attributes.action: Hold a General Election in April 2019.
attributes.background: The UK populace deserves to have a people’s vote, on which UK Party, will lead us into the future. After we leave the European Union. Give people a choice on what party will take over after 29th March 2019.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the Conservative Party, should allow this. As they have made a bit of a catastrophe out of this whole Brexit ordeal. They owe us that much. Please allow an April 2019 - UK General Election.

attributes.action: Parliament to allow the electorate to have a yes or no referendum on referendums
attributes.background: We the public are being constantly told we must have another referendum for different issues. Do we as a country want to have them in our constitution, do we have a vote on the same issue every 2 or 5 years like some want on the EU issue.
attributes.additional_details:
Some requests for referendums on the petition website: 
Hold a referendum on the final Brexit deal 
Stop possible second referendum on E.U. membership 
Hold a referendum for the legalisation of cannabis 
In 2019 hold a referendum to reinstate capital punishment 
All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future. 
Hold a referendum on Proportional Representation for parliamentary elections

attributes.action: Improve the recruiting drive for the British armed forces.
attributes.background: I don’t feel enough is being done, as a current applicant myself I can see simply not enough is being done. We need to bring back recruiting ads to TV, make the application process more appealing to a civilian and improve the quality of ad, in particular the army (look at the Royal Marines adverts).

attributes.action: Ban (military grade armour piercing) 0.50 or higher calibre rifles in the UK
attributes.background:
Despite the overwhelming support for strict gun control in the United Kingdom the Government is failing to ban certain military-grade guns in its new Offensive Weapons Bill.

This is unacceptable and places the British public at direct risk.
attributes.additional_details:
https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2017-19/offensiveweapons.html

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-politics-46377250

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/government-ban-50-caliber-offensive-weapons-bill-sajid-javid-violence-a8657046.html

attributes.action: Call to ban ‘cruel’ pupil restraint in special schools
attributes.background: Hundreds of children have suffered injuries while being physically restrained in special schools. Teachers throw children to the ground, hold them so tightly it still hurts the next day and don’t talk to them when they are in distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Something has to be done. 
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39530915

attributes.action: Redirect UK's funds from backup power subsidies to invest in renewable energy.
attributes.background:
ECJ rules UK backup power subsidies are illegal.

These subsidies counterproductively give funds to fossil fuel generators.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.jurist.org/news/2018/11/ecj-rules-uk-backup-power-subsidies-are-illegal/#

http://curia.europa.eu/juris/document/document.jsf?text=&docid=207792&pageIndex=0&doclang=en&mode=req&dir=&occ=first&part=1&cid=1430154

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/nov/15/uk-backup-power-subsidies-illegal-european-court-capacity-market

https://uk.investing.com/news/commodities-news/uk-must-halt-backup-power-scheme-after-eu-court-ruling-1382121

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/30/ban-coal-backup-power-subsidy-scheme-scottishpower

attributes.action: Require dining establishments (restaurants, bars, pubs) to offer metal straws.
attributes.background: In response to the problem of an ever-increasing amount of plastic waste polluting our environment, we need to make restaurants, bars, pubs and any similar establishments offer metal straws as a substitution for plastic straws. This will benefit our planet, dining establishments and customers alike.
attributes.additional_details: Metal straws are a better alternative to paper straws as they are reusable. Similar to dishware including mugs and glasses, metal straws can be washed and reused. Therefore, the use of metal straws will produce no waste. The reusable nature of metal straws also provide financial benefits for the establishments as it is a one-time purchase. Furthermore, it addresses the 'soggy' issue of paper straws providing a practical alternative that all people can use.

attributes.action: Change Planning Laws on Fences to require a 300mm Hole on each side for Wildlife
attributes.background: Today most New Houses have FULLY enclosed rear gardens with high fences down to the ground, seeing our Wildlife is in Decline it makes sense to help them out with these Holes so they can Roam around as they should, Humans have and keep taking away their Habitat, Hedgehogs for one do a lot of good.
attributes.additional_details:
Concrete Gravel Boards need to have one Manufactured with a Hole, wooden fences need the same when sat on the ground, Humans must try to Protect Wildlife for future Generations or we are Selfish.
 
Please Support this as our Wildlife would Appreciate it.

attributes.action: Stop firework work displays  on armistice Sunday
attributes.background: Today  on the 11/11/2018 silence fell at 11am to mark 100 years  of the first world war and  silence was across  the globe. No fireworks on this day

attributes.action: Allow first time buyers to use their pension savings as a deposit for mortgage
attributes.background: It is very difficult to save up the money and sometimes unrealistic.

attributes.action: Improvement of animal welfare labelling on all animal or animal produce products
attributes.background: Displaying shocking pictures like that on smoking packets of the welfare standards for the worse welfare foods and a rated system on all animal produce/meat foods. Legal labelling for all foods and restaurants including foods incorporating meat or produce.
attributes.additional_details: Our labelling of meat sold in supermarkets is awful. We have the red tractor and we have RSPCA assured. I am very annoyed that we still sell caged chicken eggs, why? To save the consumer a matter of pence, at the detriment to the animal, then you have “free range” which doesn’t always mean that their welfare is higher than that of a caged chicken.

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be sold in registered gun shops
attributes.background:
Restrict the sale of fireworks to just registered gun dealers. Gun dealers are competent and qualified in firearms and ammunition so are certainly the right people for judging whom they sell too.
 This will prevent fireworks from falling into the hands of youths and the wrong people.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to leave children under 13 home alone
attributes.background: There is currently no age restriction for a child being given the responsibility of staying at home alone as long as it’s not overnight and that isn’t “in a manner likely to cause unnecessary suffering or injury to health”.
attributes.additional_details:
This is NOT right, there are a range of issues including safeguarding of children. As parents and carers we have a duty to our children.

The petition is aimed to try to implement a law that states that no child under the age of 13 should be left alone at any given time, the reason for this is due to safeguarding and putting a huge responsibility on children regardless of their mental age. We are not allowed to leave children alone overnight and the same rules must apply throughout the day too. I understand a child must be given due responsibility but under the age of 13 should not be allowed due to risks and safety.

attributes.action: Allow UK students to use student loans within the EU - OR lower tuition fees
attributes.background: The conservative government in power should allow UK students to use their student loans to study at universities within the EU after Brexit OR lower our tuition fee's to minimize out debt for an education we surely need if the country is going to function without EU professional workers.
attributes.additional_details:
The freedom of information responses compiled by the Liberal Democrats from 80 of the 136 NHS acute trusts in England shows that 2,700 EU nurses left the health service in 2016, compared to 1,600 EU nurses in 2014 – a 68% increase.

If leaving the EU means letting go of many of our much-needed professionals, the UK university tuition fees need to either be lowered or student loans need to allow our youth to study where it's cheaper.

The average student debt at graduation is £50,800 - source IFS.

Do we really expect our youngest and brightest to thrive with that much debt on their shoulders?

attributes.action: Make the NHS exempt from paying business rates.
attributes.background: NHS Hospitals are facing rising business rates whilst private hospitals are able to register as a charity saving them around 80% on their business rates.

attributes.action: BAN letting TWO persons ride on a moped together
attributes.background: Whist in London taking pictures of Shard near Tower of London. Moped with two passengers mounted pavement, came from behind and as passed across the front of my nephew the back seat passenger grabbed the tripod i/c camera and carried on up the road weaving in and out dangerously with traffic.
attributes.additional_details: More than 60 crimes using mopeds or motorbikes were carried out every day in London alone on average over the past year - a 50% increase on the previous 12 months.

attributes.action: Call for an immediate halt to the offense on Idlib and an international debate
attributes.background:
Our prime minister must join those applying pressure on Russia and Iran to stop such an onslaught. Apply pressure on the UN to do what it can in calling for diplomacy. 
Find ways to help the civilians to protect themselves and deal with the humanitarian disaster which looms.
attributes.additional_details: Let us not stand by and watch whilst another humanitarian crisis unfolds. We must raise our voices in opposition!

attributes.action: Provide vegetarian friendly capsules on the NHS
attributes.background: Every time I have to have medication, I have to ask for liquid or tablets. Then when I speak to either doctors or nurses, they moan that "capsules are cheaper to make." If that is the case, change the capsules to vegetarian friendly capsules.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS should have to buy vegetarian friendly capsules where they are available and must work the drug companies to ensure that all capsules supplied to the NHS are vegetarian friendly. Most vegetarians know that capsules are not vegetarian friendly. So the more people (vegetarians and meat eaters) help to try to fight this change the better it is.

attributes.action: For victims of crime to have rights to appeal a not guilty verdict.
attributes.background: After taking my abusers to court, they were found not guilty. We should have rights like the person found guilty has fair justice. If the person's found guilty they can appeal against the sentence or case. Victims should have a proper right to appeal.
attributes.additional_details: And when the CPS and police mess your case up, like mine, there should be the right for victims to appeal. There is not enough space to put everything on. But I reach out to other victims and people in England to, get a fair justice system for now and in the future. With rights other victims may come forward.

attributes.action: Do not scrap the current Human Rights Act
attributes.background: At the time of writing this petition, the British Government are considering scrapping the current Human Rights Act after Brexit. This will create a human rights deficit which will leave many different groups in society without adequate protection from the law.

attributes.action: Introduce a Rolling road tax exemption for vehicles over 30 years old.
attributes.background:
The classic car market is booming, it would make it even more desirable, if classic cars became tax exempt after 30 years.
Fair's fair, they have already contributed a huge amount to the tax purse.
attributes.additional_details:
Classic and very collectable cars, are usually incredibly well looked after and cherished. 
It is very important to keep our motoring heritage alive.
The introduction of this tax exemption would be of a huge benifit.

attributes.action: Review impact of the Help-to-Buy scheme and take action to address failings
attributes.background:
Has H2B been targeted at the right people?
Have H2B prices been over-inflated?
Can H2B owners afford their equity loan/remortgage?
Has H2B benefitted house-builders fairly?
Are H2B houses of a suitable quality?

and many more questions to be considered.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/feb/26/persimmon-profits-help-to-buy-scheme

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-47372385

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/help-to-buy-housing-scheme-government-benefits-high-earners-property-prices-labour-a8372961.html

https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/mortgageshome/article-6107805/Are-developers-inflating-prices-homes-sold-Help-Buy.html

attributes.action: Funding and further research into Metobolic Halitosis.
attributes.background: We all know that Bad Breath is a Social Isolator which creates awkward situations to experience and also to be around. However there is increasing numbers to as much as 3 per cent of the population suffer from metabolism halitosis. This is a mutation in metabolism where sulfur compounds are made.
attributes.additional_details: New findings highlight that a protein called selenium binding controls these compounds however without this leads to increased methanethiol in the blood which releases sulfur compounds in the breath and is uncontrollable. We are asking for further research and funding available to conquer this embarrassing and socially isolating illness to be treatable.

attributes.action: Change sure start grant to 1 claim per family instead of first child only
attributes.background: We had our first child and wasn’t eligible for sure start maternity grant as we was both working we will soon be having a second child, we was told we are not eligible for the grant as we already have a child under 16 but we have never claimed it before
attributes.additional_details: I want to change it so that families can claim it for 1 child no matter weather it’s there 1st or 4th child

attributes.action: Make it illegal to hire or to dismiss someone due to personal style
attributes.background: I want to make discrimination on the grounds of Personal Style (piercings, tattoos, hair colour, etc) an offence. I want employers to consider and keep employed those who choose to express themselves via an unconventional style as long as it is safe and legal.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that expression via a chosen style is a right. I feel that policies which ban any sort of "alternative" style despite it being completely safe and legal suppress human creativity and lower staff morale. I believe a change in the law is necessary to allow for the differences between humans and to show that people who express themselves in such ways are capable of being productive and professional members of a school or workplace.

attributes.action: Make Bioptic Lenses acceptable for achieving the eyesight standard for driving.
attributes.background: Bioptic Lenses are small optical scopes, that are mounted onto the spectacle frame, to help people with sight loss see extra detail in distant objects or texts. Often used to assist visually impaired individuals that still have a functional level of vision to complete everyday tasks such as driving.
attributes.additional_details: Bioptic driving began over 30 years ago in the US and is currently accepted in over 37 states as well as several European Countries, for both car and motorcycle licenses. Current UK standards for driving have taken away the freedom and independence of thousands of individuals that would otherwise pose no additional risk to road users. Consideration, in particular, should be given to those with stable non-progressive visual disorders, where Bioptics would allow them to meet the vision standard.

attributes.action: Instigate UK Referendum on whether to complete HS/2.
attributes.background: Instigate UK Referendum on whether to complete HS/2. A UK peoples' vote is required. The likely 100B GBP could be spent on other local transportation requirements which offer a better ROI, and solve real transportation issues.
